title: igeta_(pattern)
body:
A traditional Japanese pattern consisting of four overlapping lines, similar to a hash tag symbol or pound sign (#), and particularly one of the kanji from its name (井). The pattern is meant to resemble a well. [[Daisy Mae (Animal Crossing)|]] from [[Animal Crossing]] wears an outfit featuring the pattern, which can be seen clearly in post #3832111.

h4. Reference

!asset #7734352

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* "Tag Help - Traditional Japanese Patterns":/forum_topics/6723 (Danbooru Forum Discussion Thread)

title: goshoguruma
body:
御所車 (goshoguruma, literally "ox-drawn carriage") is a [[tag group:image composition|traditional Japanese pattern]]/design of a "bullock cart.":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/牛車 A common motif in [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]]'s [[folding fan]].

For one of [[shijuuhatte]] techniques, of the same name, use [[spinning]] and [[sex]] tags (for example, post #1010478).

title: cagliostro_(youthful_uniform)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
An official alternative outfit of [[cagliostro (granblue fantasy)|Cagliostro]] released for the 2nd anniversary of Granblue Fantasy. Released March 10th, 2016.

An outfit prepared just for Cagliostro, it may look familiar to other fashions, but its detailed design and pink dancing Ouroboros make it uniquely hers. Although it is a uniform, it declares no affiliation and is solely Cagliostro's style.

title: zeta_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Character in [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i].

A spirited female knight wielding the mythic Spear of Arvess. She is a member of the shadowy group known as The Society alongside [[beatrix_(granblue_fantasy)|Beatrix]], [[eustace_(granblue_fantasy)|Eustace]], and [[vaseraga|Vaseraga]]. She wants the protagonist, who she acknowledges as a powerful, primal beast slaying warrior, to join The Society and decided to wait for their answer, joining their crew in the meantime. Eyes glittering sharp and blue, she proves her strength by pursuing only the most dangerous of prey. No wall nor enemy can stand up to her steely will and burning spear. Although her form may be fair, her words bite deeper than the tip of her spear sharp words are the mark of a hardened warrior.

h4.Official alternate costumes
[[Zeta_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)|Zeta Summer]]
[[Zeta_(halloween)_(granblue_fantasy)|Zeta Halloween]]
[[Zeta_(dark)_(granblue_fantasy)|Zeta Dark]]

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Zeta":https://gbf.wiki/Zeta

title: cagliostro_(halloween)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[cagliostro (granblue fantasy)|Cagliostro]] in her Halloween outfit. Released October 23rd, 2015.

This alchemist of singular talent lovingly selected her outfit for a spectral banquet. It was there that she uncovered the hidden truths, and watched over the transformation of the phantasmal king.

title: cagliostro_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Cagliostro (granblue fantasy)|Cagliostro]] in her summer outfit. Released July 17th, 2019.

The eternally youthful alchemist seizes the tides that flow in the abyss and incorporates their waters into a new improvement for her body. The finished process leaves her with outrageously stunning skin. Amidst the sparkling waves crashing down on the beach, her new form, now lovelier than ever before, fits perfectly into the gorgeous scenery.

title: zeta_(dark)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[zeta_(granblue_fantasy)|Zeta]]'s SSR Dark alternate form. Released February 28th, 2017.

Going undercover to discover her partner's secret, she sheds her crimson armor in favor of ordinary street clothes. At first she is caught up in the excitement of the chase, but what unfolds is a darker truth that she never saw coming.

title: cagliostro_(dark)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[cagliostro_(granblue_fantasy)|Cagliostro]]'s SSR Dark alternate form. Released April 30th, 2017.

The founder of alchemy has lived for what seems like an eternity, but she still finds new alchemic tricks up her sleeve. With her rejuvenated body, it is only a matter of time before she unlocks the door to truth in the skies—forever being the envy of all who pursue these secret arts.

title: godsworn_alexiel
body:
Character from [[Shingeki no Bahamut]] and [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Generally referred to as Alexiel.

Alexiel is a Primal Beast who serves as the disciple to [[Uriel (Granblue Fantasy)|Uriel]]. Her stoic and [[serious]] personality stands in direct and stark contrast to her master's jovial and boisterous attitude. Once a defender of the god-realm, a chance meeting with the primarch of earth led her to become his disciple. She protects the weak and reviles evil. And with her mirror-blades, she brings righteousness and justice to them both.

h4.Official Alternate Costumes
* [[alexiel_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)|Summer Alexiel]]
* [[alexiel_(Noble_triteleia)_(granblue_fantasy)|Noble Triteleia]]

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: europa_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[europa_(granblue_fantasy)|Europa]] in her summer outfit. Released July 31st, 2019.

The young maiden of water descends upon a boundless blue oceanfront, the bouquet in her hands both a gift and a symbol of deep affection from the mortal she travels with. Discerning unmatched beauty in the flowers and clutching them close, she swears to continue her journey with renewed spirit.

title: she_was_a_x_girl_he_was_a_x_boy_(meme)
body:
Image macro meme depicting or parodying a still of [[Jesse Pinkman|Jesse]] and [[Jane Margolis|Jane]] from [[Breaking Bad]]. The captioned text contrasts the interests of a girl and boy, with the phrase "she was a <interest x> girl, he was a <interest y> boy".

h4. See Also
* "Know Your Meme article":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/she-was-a-x-girl-he-was-a-x-boy]

title: helel_ben_shalem_(holiday)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[helel_ben_shalem|Helel ben Shalem]] in her holidays outfit. Released December 17th, 2023.

A gift from ancient times has made its way to the divine servant, granting warmth untold, a glimpse of the past, and a deeper bond with her current companions.

title: helel_ben_shalem_(coco-coated_dreams)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
An official alternative outfit of [[helel_ben_shalem|Helel ben Shalem]] released for Valentines. Released February 14th, 2021.

A divine servant not seen since antiquity reconnects with a world unfamiliar to her. Initially overwhelmed by the evolution of civilization, she's since become quite taken with its earthly pleasures. Upon discovering the existence of "chocolate", she luxuriates in a realm of newfound delights.

title: helel_ben_shalem_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[helel_ben_shalem|Helel ben Shalem]] in her summer outfit. Released August 16th, 2021.

This servant of the Almighty is learning about a new world, new customs, and new... summer vacations. Through these various experiences, she hopes to remember lost memories of long-gone comrades.

title: medusa_(valentine)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[medusa_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Medusa]] in her Valentines outfit. Released February 14th, 2018.

This proud primal beast, with her petrifying glare, has found new amusement in the mortal domain. The fluttering of her bewitching skirt is sure to captivate fans worldwide.

title: medusa_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Medusa in her summer outfit. Released March 19th, 2022.

Having descended upon the Alohas resort with her trio of pals, this primal beast finds herself hooked on a serpentine invention called a water slide. A stunning technique performed on it by a mortal lights a fire in Medusa's soul, and she never could refuse a challenge...

title: olivia_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[dark_angel_olivia|Dark Angel Olivia]] in her summer outfit. Released July 31st, 2018.

In hopes of reviving her brethren, the fallen archangel of dusk studies the ways of those who inhabit the Sky Realm. During the hottest month, a child of man teaches her about cherished summer customs. Despite her perceptive nature, she has yet to notice these new experiences broadening her horizons and opening her heart.

title: europa_(holiday)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[europa_(granblue_fantasy)|Europa]] in her holidays outfit. Released November 30th, 2022.

As holiday cheer fills the air, one maiden ponders deeply over what to give to a special someone. The present she settles on is more fitting for royalty than the captain of a boisterous skyfaring crew, which begs the question: is there such a thing as having too much affection for one person?

title: grimnir_(valentine)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Grimnir in his Valentines outfit. Released February 14th, 2020.

The God of War and Tempest Incarnate undertakes a new challenge, prepared to brave a storm of the unknown and face numerous trials in order to convey his true feelings. For the one he holds dear in his heart, failure is not an option.

title: alexiel_(noble_triteleia)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
An official alternative outfit of [[godsworn_alexiel|Godsworn Alexiel]] released for the 8th anniversary of [[Granblue_Fantasy|Granblue Fantasy]]. Released March 10th, 2022.

Many twists and turns went into the making of the luxurious formalwear that enrobes Alexiel. At first, she asked for Uriel's help, but the finished product mightily offended the aesthetic sense of Gabriel, who took the matter into her own hands. Having passed through a maelstrom of refashioning at the hands of the water primarch to reach the final look, Alexiel later had this to say: "The pursuit of beauty is a voyage through a great storm—its winds capable of whipping even the most serene of waters into a frenzy."

title: alexiel_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[godsworn_alexiel|Godsworn Alexiel]] in her summer outfit. Released August 15th, 2019.

Drawn to the azure seas, alabaster sands, and scorching sun, this noble defender of the god-realm descends upon the sandy beach. Slipping on a meticulously chosen piece of swimwear, the divine beauty is ready to revel in her summer reprieve.

title: ghoti_of_the_deep_beyond
body:

1+ Fish Tuners + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
The original ATK of this card becomes 500 x the number of banished monsters. If this card is Synchro Summoned during your opponent's turn: You can banish all cards on the field. During the Standby Phase of the next turn after this card was banished from the Monster Zone: You can Special Summon this banished card.

https://yugipedia.com/wiki/Ghoti_of_the_Deep_Beyond

This card is given it's name due to the quirks of the English language, in which the individual components can be read together to pronounce the word "fish."

title: lucio_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] in his summer outfit. Released July 16th, 2020.

A handsome young man shrouded in mystery stands on the shore awaiting the dawn. His expression tinged with sorrow, he prays a silent prayer to his master. Though he possesses the power to make miracles, the trial he has been given cannot be so easily overcome.

title: sandalphon_(valentine)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] in his Valentines outfit. Released February 14th, 2023.

An archangel with a passion for coffee begins a quest to find the perfect chocolate-accompanying brew. As he experiments, not only does he discover the depth behind coffee-brewing, but also something else just as important.

title: gfriend
body:
Officially named [i]Yeoja Chingu[/i] (Korean Hangul: 여자친구) - the Korean term for "Girlfriend", stylized as GFriend by the group - GFriend was a popular [[K-Pop]] girl group signed to [[Source Entertainment]]. Their hits include [i]Me Gustas Tu[/i], [i]Rough[/i] and [i]Navillera[/i].

The group was disbanded in 2021. In 2022, a new group called [b][[Viviz]][/b] was formed from former Gfriend members Eunha, SinB, and Umji.

title: ufo
body:
Short for "Unidentified Flying Object". Stereotypical depiction of an [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] originated from various description of the supposed spotting of alien spacecraft during the 1950 - 1970s "UFO craze" around the Americas.

The most common depiction of UFO are a "[[flying saucer]]", a disc-shaped spacecraft often with a glass canopy for its occupant. Though other types such as a sphere and a cigar-shaped UFO is also often depicted.

h4.See also

* [[Flying saucer]]
* [[Tractor beam]]
* [[UFO Day]]

title: palanquin_ship
body:
An [[airship]] from [[Touhou]].

The Palanquin Ship was created by [[Hijiri Byakuren]] long before the events of [[Undefined Fantastic Object]]. It is a recreation of the ship [[Murasa Minamitsu]] once fell overboard from and drowned, allowing her to be saved by Byakuren. The crew is headed by Captain Murasa, other members including [[Kumoi Ichirin]], [[Nazrin]], and [[Toramaru Shou]]. An [[airship]], it is able to sail through the sky, and even cross into other realms of existence, such as [[Makai (Touhou)|Makai]].

Although both [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]] call it a "Flying Treasure Ship", once on board, they find the ship is empty. It eventually settled in [[Gensokyo]] near the Human Village and was temporarily a granary, before being converted into a Buddhist temple named Myouren-ji (命蓮寺), or [[Myouren Temple]], after [[Hijiri Myouren|Byakuren's brother]].

The ship is drawn from the story of the Flying Storage, or Soaring Vault (飛倉), from the "[i]Shigisan-engi[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigisan-engi.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Palanquin Ship":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Palanquin_Ship

title: sideways_mouth
body:
A quirk of manga/anime art where a character's face is viewed [[profile|from the side]], yet their mouth is drawn on the side of their face, rather than on the front. 

Often the lips are still drawn on the front of the face, making it appear as if the character has two mouths.

One reason this may be done is to show more of the character's facial expression when it wouldn't otherwise be visible. Another reason is that, in animation, it's faster and easier to draw the mouth on the side than to animate the entire mouth opening normally, which would include having to adjust the jawline and lips.

h4. Examples

* !post #3160859
* !post #3086048
* !post #7169701

title: raoh_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Raoh[/b], also known by his self-proclaimed title [b]Ken-Oh[/b] ([b]拳王[/b], "Fist King"), is the main antagonist from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

He is the eldest of the four adopted children trained by Ryuken, the previous Hokuto Shinken master.

Raoh trained under Ryuken along with [[toki (hokuto no ken)|Toki]] and [[Kenshiro]], as well as another student named [[Jagi]]. In spite of his ambitions to become the greatest martial artist in the world, Raoh lost the rights to the Hokuto Shinken succession to Kenshiro. Refusing to give up the style, Raoh killed his sifu Ryuken in combat.

After the Nuclear War, Raoh has formed his own army made of various ruthless thugs and gang members, taking the name of Ken-Oh, King of Fist. Using his fearsome reputation and oppresive military and adminstrative tactics, Raoh managed to conquer the post-apocalyptic world with terror. Aimed to "seize the Heaven" by forcing several martial artists to gave up their style in order to take it for himself, thus making him the strongest of all fighters. He was later known as [b]The Conqueror of the Century's End[/b].

Raoh's hair and skin color often changes depending on the various medium he appeared in:

h4. Examples

* !post #3363451: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Parody (Manga color)]] 
* !post #654369: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Full armor (Toei)]] 
* !post #418388: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Full armor (2000 - 2005)]] 
* !post #548827: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Default (2000 - 2005)]] 
* !post #2953763: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Default (2006 Trilogy)]] 

* In the original manga, he has [[blonde hair]] and fair skin.

* In the 1984 anime, he has [[black hair]] and [[dark skin|brown skin]].

* In many video games, he has [[white hair]] and brown skin.

* In his later iterations since the 2006 [i]Hokuto no Ken[/i] trilogy movie, he has white hair and fair skin.

h4. Known moves

* 二指真空把 ([i]Nishi Shinku Ha[/i])
** An arrow shot towards the user is caught between two fingers and then deflected back towards the opponent.

* 北斗剛掌波 ([i]Hokuto Goshou Ha[/i])
** An aura blast Raoh tried to use against Kenshirou.

* 新血愁 ([i]Shinketsushuu[/i])

title: stillsuit
body:
The [b]stillsuit[/b] is a special suit that first appeared in the [[science fiction]] novel [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] from 1965. It was created and is used by the [[Fremen]] who live in the [[desert]] [[planet]] Arrakis.

It is a special [[bodysuit|body-enclosing suit]] designed to collect and recycle all the moisture the body releases, from urine, feces and sweat, to the exhalation of [[water]] vapor in the breath.

The special fabric of the suit is a micro-sandwich designed to dissipate heat and filter wastes while reclaiming moisture. The water is then held in catchpockets and made available to drink through a tube.

A Fremen in a well-kept suit can survive weeks in the desert without any other source of water.

title: raziel_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Character from [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Element: Light
Rarity: SSR
Height: 157 cm

Introduced in the 10th anniversary event, [i]Heart of the Sun[/i], Raziel is an Archangel who used to work for Lucifer. She was tasked to investigate enigmas, which she would then record in her Sefer Raziel, the blue [[book|spellbook]] in her left hand. Sefer Raziel serves as a hammerspace from which she can pull any sort of resource she has recorded, and her favorite is a [[machine gun]] that she wields in her right hand.

[b]Appearance[/b]
Raziel has [[brown hair]] in [[low twintails|low]] [[twintails]] that fall over her shoulders, as well as [[blue eyes]]. Her proportions are rather full, with [[large breasts]] and firm [[thighs]]. Raziel wears a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[leotard]] with a [[showgirl skirt]] and [[pantyhose]], and her head is adorned with a [[hat]]. The leotard is backless because her [[wings]] sprout from her [[low wings|lower back]].

title: riding_machine
body:
([i]Jouba[/i] machine)

A machine that simulates the effects of [[horseback riding]]. Exercises seldom used muscles in the dorsal and abdominal regions.

Although not intended for sexual use, it was suggestively and famously featured in several fanmade [[Idolmaster]] videos. 

Not to be confused with a [[mechanical bull]], which is a similar concept, but considerably more vigorous (and would make a poor sex toy on account of its habit of flinging its rider to the floor). Also not be confused with a [[sybian]], which IS for sexual use and only borrows the straddling position of a riding machine.

title: gogoplata
body:
A gogoplata is a type of [[choke_hold|chokehold]] also called Kagato-Jime in [[Judo]], that is used in grappling and was popularised by practitioners of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

The gogoplata is executed from a guard, commonly from a "rubber guard", where the legs are held very high against the opponent's upper back. The fighter then slips one foot in front of the opponent's head and under his chin, locks his hands behind the opponent's head, and chokes the opponent by pressing his shin or instep against the opponent's trachea. A variation called a Locoplata (popularized by Eddie Bravo) is when the practitioner uses his free foot to push up on the choking foot and increase pressure on the trachea.

Former [[WWE]] professional wrestler [[The Undertaker (wwe)|]] began using a variation of the move in January 2008 on SmackDown!, which would cause opponents to spit blood from their mouths. Former SmackDown! General Manager Vickie Guerrero (who was in the position at that time) would later kayfabe ban the move for the protection of the other wrestlers and strip The Undertaker of the World Heavyweight Championship as punishment for its use, an unprecedented move.

The move, now called the [I]Hell's Gate[/I], has since become one of The Undertaker's finishing moves.

title: dragon_sleeper
body:
A [[submission hold]] in [[wrestling]] where the attacking wrestler stands behind the opponent who is either sitting or lying face down, then pulls the opponent into an inverted facelock, often hooking the opponent's near arm with their free arm. The attacker then pulls backwards and up, wrenching the opponent's neck and spine. If the opponent is sitting, the wrestler can press their knee into the opponent's back, adding pressure. 

It is innovated by [[Fujinami Tatsumi]] and popularized in the United States by Ultimo Dragon. 

There are other variations of this hold:

1) With body scissors added to further restrain the opponent. Used by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler [[Sanada (NJPW)|SANADA]] as the [i]Skull End[/i] and [[WWE]] wrestler Drew Gulak as the [i]Gu-Lock[/i].

2) A version from a back-mount position. In other words, a hybrid with a [[camel clutch]]. Used by Low Ki as the [i]Dragon Clutch[/i],  [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Malakai Black as the [i]Owari Death Clutch[/i], [i]Dragon Slayer[/i] or [i]Dark Ritual[/i], and [[Tokyo Joshi Pro Wrestling]] wrestler Tatsumi Rika as the [I]White Dragon Sleeper[/I].

3) A standing variation. Used by [[The Undertaker (wwe)|]] as the [i]Takin' Care of Business[/i].

4) A transition from a [[surfboard (wrestling)|surfboard]] position. Used by All Elite Wrestling wrestler [[Daniel Bryan|Bryan Danielson]] as one of his signature moves.

title: ao_oni
body:
A Japanese survival horror game with RPG and puzzle elements, developed by [[noprops]] in 2008. The title is named after a folklore creature, the [[blue oni]].

Received an English translation by the early 2010s, and was adapted in various ways in the 2010s, including a novel and manga series written by Kuroda Kenji and illustrated by [[Suzuragi Karin]], a live action movie, and an anime by Studio DEEN.

Received two mobile-exclusive sequels in the late 2010s, Ao Oni 2 in 2016 and Ao Oni 3 in 2017 (which remains untranslated in English), as well as a mobile MMO called Ao Oni Online in 2018, all developed by GOODROID and published by UUUM through LiTMUS (who own the license for the Ao Oni property). 

h4. Characters

title: lugia
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #249 in the National Pokédex, a dual type Psychic/Flying [i]Legendary[/i] Pokémon

The legendary bird of the sea, albeit it is depicted with more reptilian features. Such as the lack of beak and feather, very long tail, as well as a visible fang. It is white with spiked eyes and tail and blocky wings that also double as its hand. Often associated with [[Ho-oh]] or [[Articuno]], [[Zapdos]], and [[Moltres]].  A dark version, [[Shadow Lugia]], is inverted in color, being a deep blue/purple.

Japanese name: Lugia

Prior Pokémon: [[Tyranitar]]
Next Pokémon: [[Ho-Oh]]

title: bonbori_(lighting)
body:
Traditional Japanese [[floor lamp|floor standing lamp]] on a pillar to raise the light high. It always has round shape made of paper on wood or bamboo frame.

h4. See also
* [[Andon (lighting)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Bonbori":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traditional_lighting_equipment_of_Japan#Bonbori

title: rape_face
body:
This tag is used for characters who have a creepy expression on their faces that makes them look like as if they're about to rape or kill someone, often involving squinted, shifty eyes and a creepy, predatory smile.

For obvious reasons, often paired with [[you gonna get raped]].
